fields.host_about:
Γειά σας, ονομάζομαι Χρήστος Δημητρακόπουλος,είμαι 38 ετών, είμαι κάτοικος Αθηνών, το επάγγελμά μου είναι εργολάβος οικοδομών, κατασκευάζω και ανακαινίζω κτήρια και αγαπώ πολύ αυτό που κάνω.
Τον ελεύθερο χρόνο μου ασχολούμαι με πολεμικές τέχνες, μου αρέσει να ταξιδεύω και ανακαλύπτω νέα μέρη, είμαι άνθρωπος φιλικός και φιλόξενος και θα χαιρόμουν πολύ να φιλοξενώ ταξιδιώτες από όλα τα μέρη του κόσμου.Μπορείτε να βρείτε τον οικοδεσπότη στο όνομα Xristos Dimitrakopoulos στο (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN)

Hello, I am Xristos Dimitrakopoulos, I am a constructor, and I love to build and restore houses. I also love to travel and see new places and people. Furthermore I  like martial arts and  I spend a lot of time with friends from all over the world.
You can find me on (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) under the name Xristos Dimitrakopoulos

fields.transit: Ampelokipi metro station is at 10 minutes walking distance. There is also a bus terminal that serves the centre of Athens and all the major attractions (Acropolis, Syntagma, Monastiraki, Plaka, The National Archaelogical Museum, etc). We can also assist you by organising private transport with one of our reliable drivers. We work with taxi as well as minivan drivers (taxis carry up to 4 passengers) who will wait for you in the arrivals hall, no matter how long you may be delayed, and bring you straight to the apartment.   Guest services will discuss further after a booking is confirmed!
fields.neighborhood_overview: This quiet neighbourhood on the foot of Lycabettus hill, offers a choice of excellent restaurants, a weekly open air green market. The Athens Concert Hall - Megaro Mousiki is also located at close walking distance.
fields.space: We call this apartment ST8.  Apartment ST8 is a really unique apartment situated on the foot of Lycabettus hill, in the centre of Athens. It has 4 bedrooms and a large luminous living room with wrap-around windows, offering a bird's eye view of the city of Athens.  Guests can enjoy dinners on the large 10-seat dinner table with city views in the background.  The master bedroom features a king size bed that can be set up as two singles. The second bedroom has a double bed that can also be set up as two singles, as well as another single bed. The third bedroom has a double bed and the fourth bedroom has two single beds.  All bedrooms are equipped with high quality mattresses, bed linen and towels. There is an en suite full bathroom, 2 more bathrooms with showers and extra wc. A fully equipped kitchen, a study room, a laundry room with washer / dryer, 2 satellite TV sets and free wifi internet access, all add to the comfort of the guests. A choice of excellent restaurants in the area and

fields.house_rules: • We are happy to provide flexible check in and check out times, so just let us know when you would like to arrive and depart and we will do our best to satisfy your requests. Please note that depending on availability check in will be by 3pm and check out is by 11am. • Check in between the hours of 9pm and 9am. Our staff work from 9am until 9pm every day. So, if you are checking in between 9pm and 9am we have asked our reliable taxi drivers to check you in. This allows you to arrive at any time you like. You can check in at any time after 9pm and before 9am by simply booking your transport to the apartment via one of our trusted taxi drivers. They charge no extra to check you in. On arrival he will let you into the apartment and ask you what time you would like our permanent staff to take you on a tour of the area and to show you the apartment in detail. • Smoking is allowed only outside the apartment THANK YOU
fields.description: This is a really unique apartment situated on the foot of Lycabettus hill in the centre of Athens. It has a huge living room with a bird's eye view of the city of Athens. fields.host_about:
We at Boutique Athens offer accommodation to travellers who are interested in the cultural and artistic pursuits on offer in our amazing city, Athens.
We own and manage several fully serviced, high quality apartments in the centre of the city.
We are interested in food, art, modern history and what is new and exciting.
We personally meet and greet our guests.
We provide full kitchens for cooking, a wonderful art collection and many books on Modern Greece.
fields.interaction: We meet and greet our guests. We take them on a short orientation tour and offer them any assistance they require.
fields.name: Exclusive apt with panoramic views!

fields.neighborhood_overview: The house is between Kolonaki a posh neighborhood with all kind of restaurants bars,cafes,places for massage and spa, and Exarchia an alternative and  artistic neighborhood with lots of students, nice cafes, bars and taverns where you can enjoy Greek cuisine and drink ouzo. A big mall is also very close, it is named Attica city link and it is 2 min walk from Panepistimio metro station. Every Saturday there is a local street market on the next road of the appartment where you can take a walk.

fields.access: From the airport: - By taxi (adout 45 euros)  - By the means of transport,take the metro from the airport (line blue) to Agia Marina and disembark at Ambelokipi station, exit Leoforos Alexandras/Panornou. Outside of the metro station there is a bus station, take the bus number 230 (Zografou -Akrpoli) with direction to Akropoli and stop at Tsimiski station (5 stops). From Panepistimio metro stasion (red line): - On foot (10 min) - Take the bus 230 (Akropoli - Zografou) with direction to Zografou and stop at Tsimiski station (5 stops)

fields.summary: A renovated warm flat in the centre of the city, just 10 min walk from Panepistimio metro station. It is located near to the famous neighborhood of Kolonaki and the historic centre of Athens.

fields.transit: the house is exactly 2.7 km from the Acropolis. You will need three bus stops (or an about 20-minute walk) to get to the nearest metro station which is Panepistimio or Omonoia (exactly 1.2 and 1.3 km from the house respectively) and two metro stops to get to the Acropolis. Buses are constantly passing by towards the historical center three streets away from the house.
fields.neighborhood_overview: the house is located in exarcheia, which is a region in downtown Athens, very vivid by night and day. Many artists and intelllectuals live here, and shows often take place in the square. My house is 500 m away from that so it is not so fussy.  Strefi Hill is within a five-minute walk.

fields.host_about:
I have lived in Athens for the past 8 years. I work as an architect. I have chosen to live in exarcheia because its culture and life style suits me perfectly! I enjoy meeting up with friends for walkabouts, dinner and drinks , i love dancing.
My dream destination is Mexico, but I would like to go everywhere really!
I would be happy to share with you everything I know about Athens and especially Exarcheia, when we meet up!
fields.interaction: I would be happy to share all the information I have!

It consists of one bedroom, one kitchen, one bathroom and an open space living room. It is on the fifth floor of the building and has a large balcony with flowers. It is located at Lycabettus area and it is only 100m from the hill. The city centre is in a walking distance or easily reached by bus or the nearby metro (Ampelokipi Metro Station) Taxi ride costs less than 4 euros from/to the city center

fields.space: The apartment has a free bedroom with two single beds, a fan, a wardrobe, a fully equipped kitchen, one bathroom and Wifi connection. It is around 50 m², with a small private balcony. It is located in the center of Athens, 10 mins walk to the subway, but you can reach many destinations on foot.  The Archaeological Museum is only 5 minutes walking distance and there are also plenty of choices in bars and restaurants around the area! All of the famous places and sight seeings of Athens  are just two or three stops away by using the metro.

fields.transit: In less than 10 mins you reach the pedestrianised network of streets of central Athens, making walking easy. Omonia metro station is 7 mins walk from the flat. From there you have easy access to the airport (50mins) and the port (20mins).
fields.neighborhood_overview: The flat is centrally located, with most tourist attractions nearby. The National Archaelogical museum is 2 mins away, while the center with the trendy Agia Eirini square full of cafes, restaurants and bars is a 15 min walk. Another 5-10mins and you are at Monastiraki, Plaka, the Acropolis, or the parliament square - basically all the interesting places in Athens. The lively student area of Exarchia with more bars, coffee places and places to eat is just 5 mins away.
fields.features: Host Is Superhost,Host Has Profile Pic,Host Identity Verified,Is Location Exact
fields.space: Large 140sqm (1500sqft) prestigious flat in one of the first apartment buildings in Athens overlooking the old university and home to famous singer of the 50s, has been fully restored/renovated maintaining many of the old features. It now has 4 separate rooms with private wc, sharing a spacious dining room, sitting room and fully equipped kitchen. Room 1 has a bedroom, a separate lounge room with a sofa bed and an en-suite bathroom. Room 2 has a private bathroom opposite the bedroom. Room 3 has a walk-in closet and an en-suite bathroom. Room 4 has an en-suite bathroom and faces the back of the building. All bedrooms have beautiful wooden floors, a queen-sized (160cm) bed with very comfortable mattress, air-conditioning,  desk and mirror, and can be locked separately. All rooms have a private wc with shower, and towels, soap and shampoo for you to use. The dining room has a large wooden table. The kitchen is fully equipped and there is a sitting room with maps and tips to plan your day,

fields.description: Fully restored old central Athens apartment, next to the National Archaelogical museum with tourist highlights, cafes and shopping within easy walking distance. The spacious and bright flat boasts 4 bedrooms, one with an extra lounge room with a sofa-bed, and a common dining room, sitting room and kitchen. Each room has a queen sized bed with a super-anatomic mattress and a private bathroom. The flat is 7mins from Omonia metro, offering easy access to airport/port. fields.host_about: Born in Athens, and now back in Athens after 20 years in London. Experienced traveller, love to talk about different places and new adventures.
fields.name: Spacious 4BD flat next to Archaelogical Museum
fields.notes: The flat boasts wifi with a fast 50Mbps internet connection, a washing machine, hair-dryer, iron and ironing board. The kitchen is fully equipped with electric hobs, fridge-freezer, coffee maker, sandwich toaster, toaster and kettle. No TV! Can also book individual rooms, in which case common areas may be shared with other guests. I will try to accomodate early check in  / late check out, if possible.

fields.description: Welcome to The Suites, Where Austin living meets classic Hollywood. The Suites combine impeccable accommodations, stellar surroundings, and first class customer service. When staying here life is filled with upscale amenities and perks. The amazing location puts you near downtown hot spots, retail, restaurants, and night life. When it is time to unwind, head to one of our resort style pools with cabanas, sun loungers and outdoor TV's.

fields.street: Montview Street, Austin, TX 78756, United States
fields.neighborhood_overview: Allandale is a coveted, very livable neighborhood about 15 minutes north of downtown Austin.  Easy access to restaurants, bars, coffee houses, convenience & grocery stores (many are walkable). Want to try the local fare?  Walk to The Peached Tortilla, Lucy’s Fried Chicken, Fonda San Miguel for Interior Mexican fare, Monkey's Nest Coffee, Epicere Cafe & Grocery.   Looking for a bar to watch the game at or see some live music at?  Walk to Little Woodrows or The Little Longhorn Saloon Have kids?  Walk to Hat Creek Burger Co or Phil’s Icehouse/Amy’s Ice Cream for food and playtime.
fields.features: Host Is Superhost,Host Has Profile Pic,Host Identity Verified,Is Location Exact
fields.space: Cozy and comfortable (approx 600 sq ft), this is a second floor apartment above a garage located in Allandale (near 2222 and Burnet Rd).   It is a 1 bedroom with a sleeper sofa in the living room.  It has a full bath and the kitchen includes a refrigerator, cooktop, microwave, and toaster oven.  Note: There is NOT a dishwasher or full-size oven.  There is a washer/dryer in the garage available for your use. The space is ideal for the solo business traveler, couples traveling alone or with children/friends or for a small group of friends.
fields.access: Guests will access the apt via the screened-in patio between the house and apt.   Guests will have full access to the apartment, the balcony off the apartment and the garage for doing laundry (if necessary).   If you have little kids, you are welcome to let them burn off energy in the yard.

fields.space: My spacious living room is available for guests, with a patio easily accessible, no smoking cigarettes inside, but if you smoke, you may step outside on the front patio, with plenty of comfortable seats available to enjoy your stay.  I'm an easy going young professional, a musician and public speaker for charities and non profits.  I think we can all make the world a better place by being better ourselves
fields.access: I have both a loveseat and a couch available, with wifi, kitchen, and bathroom. On weekdays, guests must leave in the morning before 7am Central Standard Time, as that is when I lock up and leave for work.  Friday and Saturday nights, guests can sleep in, with check out times noon to 1pm Central Standard Time.

fields.house_rules: Please clean up after yourself, wash any dishes you use, be respectful, give what you wish to receive interaction wise, no drugs, beer or wine is ok but not to the point of getting drunk.  I am a great conversationalist, but may not have time to be super social depending on my work schedule, but often, it may work out we toast to manifesting the best destiny and have a cool convo if the dynamic is right.

Friday and Saturday nights, guests can sleep in, with check out times noon to 1pm Central Standard Time. I'm an honest straight forwar
fields.host_about:
I'm a friendly honest person who enjoys feeling like I'm
making the world a better place through volunteering
at homeless shelters, teaching kids to juggle at summer camps,
working with nonprofits and community orgs to support my
city being the best place to live.  My past times include art, and music, making songs that are positive and uplift the global consciousness. We are all works in progress, as long as we continue to progress.  I'm real with you as long as you are real with me. 

After more than one person canceling reservations after saying they are definitely staying here during SXSW, I politely ask for dependable trust worthy requests and clear communication, with as little flakiness as possible.
If your request is preapproved, please confirm and book within a few hours so that I may inform others also wanting to check in, I appreciate your understanding. Thanks!
fields.interaction: I'm an honest straight forward person, friendliness and good communication skills go a long way, and will ensure your stay is pleasant

fields.neighborhood_overview: Hyde Park, a very safe neighborhood, is a 10 minute drive from downtown and a 5 minute drive to the University of Texas campus. It's very walkable, quiet, beautiful and relaxing compared to the hustle of busy downtown during SXSW.

fields.description: Our first floor apartment has over 1,000 sq ft of open kitchen/living room/dining room space, a large balcony with seating, 2 large bedrooms and a dual-vanity bathroom (with amazing water pressure!). Rental comes with 1 parking spot and a variety of free guest spots. Rental is located within a short walking distance of a gorgeous grocery store, shopping, Starbucks, a sports bar and multiple restaurants.  The public bus line is a 5 minute walk away and makes getting to SXSW easy and affordable. Great share if you're coming with friends, share beds or don't mind sleeping on a couch. Gate access to pool, gym, jogging trail, business center and parking garage. I am in town and available for any questions, concerns,  or needs. As a concierge, I can help guests with public transportation, advice on neighborhoods, restaurants, and things to do around town. Hyde Park, a very safe neighborhood, is a 10 minute drive from downtown and a 5 minute drive to the University of Texas campus. It's very
fields.host_about:
A city-dweller for 5 years, I am a young professional copywriter, making my living writing ads for a big ad agency. I am single, but live with my trusty dog, Jude. Together we run, jog and roam the city. I want to travel more, so I signed up for this site in hopes to get out of the city and have nice people stay at my place to help me pay for my adventures. 

I love finding new bars and restaurants, and the Upper East Side is the perfect place to do just that. 

If you're visiting the city, I'd say definitely bring along a subway map because taxis can be pricey, and always bring an iPod or music with you. It's a great way to pass the time while you walk around, and make your own city soundtrack.
fields.interaction: I am in town and available for any questions, concerns,  or needs. As a concierge, I can help guests with public transportation, advice on neighborhoods, restaurants, and things to do around town.
fields.name: Entire Apartment for SXSW Getaway
fields.notes: Apartment is very clean, free or bed bugs or pet hair, smoke or other allergy concerns.

fields.transit: We're about 3 miles north of downtown and the University area. If you have a car, there's convenient street parking in front of the house. Otherwise, we've listed some transportation options below: • Bikes - It's a pretty relaxed, 15 minute bike ride (2-3 miles) to the capitol building/downtown/6th street area, though slightly more on the way back because it's a bit uphill. You can use the bike map to decide if this is a good option for you based on your itinerary and how much you like biking. We think that one of the best ways to enjoy Austin is by bicycle, and most people who have stayed with us have loved the freedom of being able to bike around the city. • Buses - There's a bus stop down the street from our house and Capital Metro's Trip Planner is pretty great for learning how to get from place to place. Buses generally arrive about every 20 minutes, but the buses aren't always on time and they don't run very late. You can also put bikes on the bus, but there is only space for two
fields.street: Red River Street, Austin, TX 78751, United States
fields.neighborhood_overview: We live in the fun and friendly Hyde Park/North Loop area. We're located near the Hancock Shopping center, where there's a big grocery store (H-E-B) and a handful of other shops. We're also within walking/biking distance to some great coffee shops and bars, bookstores, vintage stores, farmer's markets, yoga studios, a bike shop, a juice bar, vegan ice cream parlor, a donut shop, some pizza shops, a few restaurants, and several food trailers (like a biscuits and gravy trailer and a vegan taco trailer). More details about places near us can be found in your room.
fields.features: Host Is Superhost,Host Has Profile Pic,Host Identity Verified,Is Location Exact,Require Guest Profile Picture
fields.space: You'll be renting a studio space in our house. It has a couch, an air mattress, and a granite-top work desk with a stool. The room has three windows, so it lets in lots of natural light if you open the curtains. It is just down the hall from the bathroom, which is shared with the rest of the household (Cristen, Miguel, and Daniel).
fields.access: Renters have access to:  • 1 ROOM (available for one or two people)  • CLEAN BLANKETS, SHEETS, and TOWELS  • WIFI  • BIKE WITH LOCK & LIGHTS We think that the best way to enjoy Austin is by bicycle and we have several bikes to choose from. They are not the nicest, newest bikes, but they'll get you where you need to go. Most people who borrow them are happy with them.  • WASHING MACHINE We have a washing machine that you're welcome to use. • TEA/COFFEE You're welcome to help yourself to coffee, tea, and whatever breakfast materials we happen to have at the moment (fruit, bread, jams, granola, etc.) • KITCHEN  We have lots of pots, pans, utensils, and spices for those who want to cook meals at the house. We also love cooking and if you stay with us long enough, you'll likely be invited to share a meal with us. • LIVING ROOM/PORCH AREA  We like to think of our place as one big compound where everyone shares the communal spaces (living/porch/backyard areas) and everyone feels welcome, so d
fields.amenities: Internet,Wireless Internet,Air conditioning,Kitchen,Free parking on premises,Pets live on this property,Cat(s),Heating,Washer,Dryer,Essentials,Shampoo,Iron,Laptop friendly workspace
fields.house_rules: We live a pretty communal lifestyle and are used to sharing our living space with other people. It's a good vibe around here where everyone does their part to make this a comfortable place to be. Here are some house rules that we expect all guests to follow. It's a compilation of things we've encountered after years of hosting. -Check-in/check-out times are usually very flexible, but please let us know in advance what to expect. This helps us plan our day and to make sure we have enough time to clean the room before/after other guests. -Smoking is not allowed indoors. -Don't bring other people to the house unless you clear it with us first (this includes friends, strangers from the bar, etc. If you book as one person, you should arrive as one person.) -If you borrow a bike, please take good care of it. Bikes locked downtown overnight can easily be stolen, so it is your responsibility to bring the bike back to the house. Same goes for bike lights. Please take them off the bike when park
fields.description: This is a studio room for one or two people in our cozy and lively Austin house (located in the Hyde Park/North Loop area). It's a short bus ride to downtown and your room comes with bikes for adventuring around the city during SXSW. You'll be renting a studio space in our house. It has a couch, an air mattress, and a granite-top work desk with a stool. The room has three windows, so it lets in lots of natural light if you open the curtains. It is just down the hall from the bathroom, which is shared with the rest of the household (Cristen, Miguel, and Daniel). Renters have access to:  • 1 ROOM (available for one or two people)  • CLEAN BLANKETS, SHEETS, and TOWELS  • WIFI  • BIKE WITH LOCK & LIGHTS We think that the best way to enjoy Austin is by bicycle and we have several bikes to choose from. They are not the nicest, newest bikes, but they'll get you where you need to go. Most people who borrow them are happy with them.  • WASHING MACHINE We have a washing machine that you're welco
fields.host_about: I like gardening, cooking, reading, being outdoors, working on various crafty endeavors, and taking advantage of all the amazing events and live music in our city. I've been in Austin my whole life and I can't seem to leave. That said, I love to travel and I've spent time in many different places around the world. I work as a freelance educational writer and spend most of my time during the week working in the office room of our house or at a coffee shop nearby. I'm the one who manages our Airbnb listing, but I live with my partner, Miguel, and Catbus, an orange cat who adopted us a few years ago. Miguel works at a Mediterranean cafe, and also does screen printing, carpentry, and landscaping work. We both love meeting new people and opening up our home to fun folks who need a short-term place to stay in Austin. We live a pretty communal lifestyle and are used to sharing our living space with other people.
fields.interaction: If you're someone who likes to keep to yourself, you'll have all the privacy you want in your room. The house is often pretty quiet during the week and we tend to keep busy, so minimal interaction with us is absolutely fine. We keep the common areas clean, and we're always respectful of our guests and their personal space. If you're into a more social atmosphere, that's cool too. Some weeks are quieter than others, but you're certainly welcome to join in on anything we end up doing while your'e in town. We also sometimes have people over for dinner, movies, backyard bonfires, and other gatherings. We want to make sure that those who stay with us feel comfortable and welcome, so if there's anything you need, just ask! We're happy to answer any questions or recommend things for you to do!
fields.name: Room + Bike in Hyde Park
fields.notes: We love our happy home, feel it's a great representation of Austin, and enjoy sharing it with people who will appreciate it too. That said, we know our house is not for everyone. We've shared our home with quite a few people over the years, so we've learned what works and what doesn't. Please read below to make sure our place is a good fit for you, and if you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask. THIS IS A GREAT PLACE FOR YOU IF:  • You're looking for an old, unconventional Austin house with a lot of character in a fun, friendly environment  • You're laid back, easy to get along with, and would rather stay with local Austinites than in a hotel • You have a complete profile (THAT IS YOUR PROFILE) with a photo and are willing to send us a personalized request. If we're going to open up our house to you, we want to know who you are.
fields.summary: This is a studio room for one or two people in our cozy and lively Austin house (located in the Hyde Park/North Loop area). It's a short bus ride to downtown and your room comes with bikes for adventuring around the city during SXSW.
